alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 12:26PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated water levels along the West Coast Sunday and Monday... A strong weather system moving to the West Coast will bring elevated water levels to the coast south of the Bering Strait Sunday night and Monday and north of the Bering Strait on Monday. Water levels are expected to be 3 to 6 feet above the normal high tide line. Water levels will be similar to the system that brought elevated water to the area a couple weeks ago. Water is expected to push into the old runway at Golovin, and bring elevated water levels to Kotlik. Water levels are expected to be similar to the system that brought elevated water along the coast north of the Bering Strait a couple weeks ago including Kotzebue, Kivalina and Red Dog Dock. Water will also be pushed up on top of the ice along the coast. For the latest information go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta
